alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 10 at 6:54PM MST until August 10 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 815 PM MST. * At 652 PM MST, a wall of dust pushing through northwest Pinal county was approaching south central portions of the county. In addition, additional storms were developing between Casa Grande and Tucson that could generate blowing dust. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 206 and 231. Route 79 between mile markers 99 and 105. Route 87 between mile markers 116 and 123. Locations impacted include... Eloy, Picacho, Chui-Chu, Picacho Peak State Park, Red Rock, Cockleburr, North Komelik, Kohatk, Jack Rabbit, Shopishk and East Chui-Chu. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
